definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: But he has not lost control of the upper-house Senate.
sentences.chinese: 但是他仍能掌控上議院。

sentences.english: He was elevated to the Lords in succession to his father.
sentences.chinese: 他繼承父業升爲上議院議員。

sentences.english: The more fiefs Your Lords have the larger army they can have.
sentences.chinese: 更封地您上議院有較大的軍隊，他們可以擁有。

sentences.english: He entered London society and spoke in the House of Lords.
sentences.chinese: 他進入了倫敦社交界，在上議院發表演講。

sentences.english: It's thought she may eventually accept a peerage and move to the House of Lords.
sentences.chinese: 人們認爲她最終可能接受貴族頭銜，進入上議院。

sentences.english: Bills of Attainder were normally initiated in the House of Lords.
sentences.chinese: 《掠奪公權法案》通常由上議院制定。

sentences.english: You can assign fiefs to your lords .
sentences.chinese: 您可以指定到您的上議院領地。

sentences.english: I will explain and critically evaluate the House of Lords decision in the followings.
sentences.chinese: 我將接下來解釋和批判性評估以下上議院做出的決定。

definition: lower chamber (of legislative body)/lower house/the House of Commons
François Hollande (1954-), French Socialist politician, president of France 2012-2017
Netanyahu (name)/Benjamin Netanyahu (1949-), Israeli Likud politician, prime minister 1996-1999 and from 2009
Edward Snowden (1983-), American surveillance program whistleblower
Angela Merkel (1954-), German CDU politician, chancellor from 2005
